column12: VERFAHREN ZUM REGELN EINER GASTURBINE SOWIE GASTURBINE ZUR DURCHFÜHRUNG DES VERFAHRENS.
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft ein Verfahren zum Regeln einer Gasturbine (10), insbesondere bei transienten Betriebszuständen, welche Gasturbine (10) einen Verdichter (11) zum Verdichten von angesaugter Verbrennungsluft, eine Brennkammer (13) zum Erzeugen von Heissgas durch Verbrennen eines Brennstoffs mittels der verdichteten Verbrennungsluft sowie eine mehrstufige Turbine (15) zum Entspannen des erzeugten Heissgases unter Arbeitsleistung umfasst, wobei die Regelung nach Massgabe der Heissgastemperatur erfolgt, welche aus mehreren anderen gemessenen Betriebsgrössen der Gasturbine (10) abgeleitet wird. Eine sichere Beherrschung der Maschine auch bei schnellen Änderungen wird dadurch erreicht, dass zur Ableitung der Heissgastemperatur ausschliesslich Druckmessungen (P1, P2, P3) an verschiedenen Stellen der Gasturbine (10) herangezogen werden.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT

column12: VERFAHREN ZUR HERSTELLUNG EINER GASENTLADUNGSLICHTQUELLE
column13: A method for producing a gas discharge light source for emitting an electromagnetic radiation comprising a gas discharge tube filled with at least one discharge gas material and having a means for generating a gas discharge includes the following method steps: igniting the gas discharge tube filled with the discharge gas material, performing a forming operation in which the electrical operating power of the gas discharge light source is at least as high as the desired continuous operation power, the gas discharge tube is held at a temperature which is at least as high as the subsequent operating temperature, the intensity of the emitted electromagnetic radiation in the region of the desired wavelengths is monitored and the partial pressure of the vaporized discharge gas material is varied until the intensity of the selected electromagnetic radiation has reached a maximum value, whereupon a reservoir with excess discharge gas material is separated from the gas discharge tube in such a manner that the gas discharge tube under operating conditions does not contain any condensed discharge gas material. A gas discharge tube having a discharge material forming a discharge gas under operating conditions is distinguished in that the discharge gas material is incorporated in the inner wall of the gas discharge tube and there is no longer any condensed discharge gas material in the gas discharge tube.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT

column12: METHOD FOR CONTROLLING A GAS TURBINE AND GAS TURBINE FOR IMPLEMENTING THE METHOD
column13: A method for controlling a gas turbine, including during transient operating states, and such a gas turbine are provided. The gas turbine includes a compressor for compressing inducted combustion air, a combustion chamber for generating hot gas by combusting a fuel with the aid of the compressed combustion air, and a multistage turbine for expanding the generated hot gas and performing work. The controlling of the gais turbine is carried out in accordance with the hot gas temperature which is derived from a plurality of other measured operating variables of the gas turbine. A reliable controlling of the gas turbine is achieved, even during rapid changes, by pressure measurements being gathered exclusively at different points of the gas turbine for derivation of the hot gas temperature.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT
column16: GENERAL ELECTRIC TECHNOLOGY GMBH (2015-11-02);;ANSALDO ENERGIA SWITZERLAND AG (2017-01-09)

column12: Ski practice and exercise appts. - consisting of moulded unit locating balls of feet for practice of ski swings
column13: The fitness apparatus, is for practising the ski 'swing' technique. The apparatus consists of a unit placed on the floor and fitted with a polished surface. The unit has two moulds (4, 5) lying next to each other to receive the balls of the foot which run into a curvature for the heel support with it's highest point located on the symmetric axis of both moulds (4, 5). The curvature reduces outwards on either side of the symmetric axis thus forming a rotating sliding surface (6) extending over a swivel area of about 90 degrees. The profiled unit (1) is fitted with a curved, flexible surround (7) to limit the swivel movement and is positioned on a slip mat (3) providing elasticity and protection against sliding on the floor.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT

column12: Floor conveyor
column13: A floor conveyor has a trough-shaped load receptacle (5) which can be pivoted about a pivot axis (6) out of an upper position down into a lower position in which it is located in front of the floor conveyor. A support (9) is coupled to the frame (1) of the floor conveyor by means of coupling elements (10, 11). A coupling (17) connects the front coupling element (10) to the load receptacle (5). The described coupling of the support (9) causes the support (9) to move out automatically when the load receptacle (5) is tipped down and to move automatically back into its retracted position during the reverse movement sequence. <IMAGE>
column15: FUCHS HERBERT

column12: Instrument monitoring parking intervals, receives external signals wirelessly
column13: The parking instrument comprises a timing device (12) which calculates the parking time span during the park mode, and a receiver (14), which receives an activation signal (A) by wireless means. The receiver has a radio transmitter (15), and an infared receiver (16) and transmitter (17). The transmitter identifies a new parking place user and parking data is collated. An Independent claim is included for the method of monitoring parking, in which activation- (A) and deactivation- (D) signals are received from the exterior, by wireless means, especially by transmission of infra red- or radio signals.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT

column12: METHOD OF MANUFACTURE OF A GAS DISCHARGE LIGHT SOURCE
column13: Ein Verfahren zur Herstellung einer Gasentladungslichtquelle zur Abgabe einer elektromagnetischen Strahlung mit einer Gasentladungsröhre, die mit zumindest einem Entladungsgasmaterial gefüllt ist, und mit einer Einrichtung zur Erzeugung einer Gasentladung, weist folgende Verfahrensschritte auf: Zünden der mit dem Entladungsgasmaterial gefüllten Gasentladungsröhre, Durchführung eines Formierungsvorgangs, bei welchem die elektrische Betriebsleistung der Gasentladungslichtquelle mindestens so hoch ist wie die angestrebte Dauerbetriebsleistung, die Gasentladungsröhre auf einer Temperatur gehalten wird, die mindestens so hoch ist wie die spätere Betriebstemperatur, die Intensität der emittierten elektromagnetischen Strahlung im Bereich der gewünschten Wellenlängen überwacht wird, und der Partialdruck des verdampften Entladungsgasmaterials variiert wird, bis die Intensität der ausgewählten elektromagnetischen Strahlung einen Maximalwert erreicht hat, worauf ein Reservoir mit überschüssigem Entladungsgasmaterial auf solche Weise von der Gasentladungsröhre abgetrennt wird, daß die Gasentladungsröhre unter Betriebsbedingungen kein kondensiertes Entladungsgasmaterial enthält. Eine Gasentladungsröhre mit einem Entladungsgasmaterial, das unter Betriebsbedingungen ein Entladungsgas bildet, zeichnet sich dadurch aus, daß das Entladungsgasmaterial in der Innenwand der Gasentladungsröhre eingelagert ist und kein kondensiertes Entladungsgasmaterial mehr in der Gasentladungsröhre vorhanden ist.
column15: FUCHS, HERBERT KARL
column32: PATENT ABSTRACTS OF JAPAN vol. 6, no. 60 (E-102)(938) 17. April 1982 & JP-A-57 003 345 ( TOKYO SHIBAURA ) 8. Januar 1982

column12: Hinge between two parts of a spectacle frame.
column13: Es wird ein Scharniergelenk zwischen zwei Teilen eines Brillengestells, nämlich einem Bügel (4) und einem Bügelbacken (1), mit einem an einem der beiden Teile angeordneten, gegen den anderen Teil vorragenden und in eine Aufnahmetasche (5) dieses Teiles eingreifenden Scharnierlappen (2), der eine Scharnierachse bildende Achsstummel (3) trägt, und mit von der Aufnahmetasche (5) ausgehenden, kreiszylindrischen Lagerausnehmungen (6) mit einer Einführöffnung (7) zur schnappverschlußartigen Aufnahme der Achsstummel (3) beschrieben, wobei die Lagerausnehmungen (6) in einem der Bügelinnenseite zugekehrten Umfangsabschnitt zur Bildung der Einführöffnung (7) und des Schnappverschlusses offen sind und wobei der Bügelbacken (1) einen stirnseitigen Anschlag (9) für den Bügel (4) in der Strecklage des Scharniergelenkes mit einer quer zur Bügelachse verlaufenden Anschlagfläche (10) aufweist.

column12: Apparatus for decorating articles with peel-off pictures
column13: An apparatus for applying peel-off pictures to ceramic articles (2) has a magazine (12) for the peel-off pictures (4), a heating plate (26) for heating the peel-off pictures (4), a picture holder (24) and an elastic pad (32) which is movable between two work stations. The peel-off pictures (4) have a decorative layer (6) which is connected to a carrier foil (8) via a bonding layer adhesive as a function of temperature. The apparatus has a high throughput, because, in a first work station (S1), at least two heating plates (26) are arranged interchangeably in such a way that either one of them faces the picture holder (24) located in the first work station (S1) and the other faces the pad (32) located in the first work station (S1). <IMAGE>
column15: FUCHS GERHARD;;PAANS HERBERT

column12: Wood drying equipment comprizes chamber fed with heated pressurized fresh air as circulated and drawn off as moisture-laden air to associated condensate container via three-way valve arrangement.
column13: Sawn timber (8) is dried in a chamber (1) fed by line (12) with fresh air and is there heated before circulating round the chamber via blower (4) so the moisture-laden air can then be drawn off by line (13). The fresh air line (12) issues into the chamber via a guide strip (6) with air outlets on its top and bottom narrow sides and the moist air is led out of the chamber via a strip (7) in channel form with inlets on top and bottom sides and cooled down in the offtake line (13). The air heater and air cooler comprize a heat exchanger (14) having top surface expander ribs (15). The incoming fresh air is pressurized by blower or compressor (25) as against the offtake line (13) which is equipped with a condensate container (22). The compressed (25) air enters a three-way valve (23) whence air passes over three-way valves (15,17) off lines (28,29) into the feed and offtake lines respectively (12,13).
column15: WOLF JOHANN;;FUCHS HERBERT

column12: Drying products, especially of wood, containing moisture involves keeping total pressure in condensation chamber lower than in vacuum chamber by preselected adjustable amount
column13: The method involves heating the products (5) in a vacuum chamber (1) in a water vapor atmosphere and condensing the water vapor emanating from the product outside the vacuum chamber in a chamber (14) under a vacuum. The total pressure in the condensation chamber is held lower than the total pressure in the vacuum chamber by a preselected adjustable amount independent of the difference between the temp. in the vacuum and condensation chambers. An Independent claim is also included for an arrangement for implementing the method.
column15: WOLF JOHANN;;FUCHS HERBERT

column12: Inductive melting apparatus for melting metals has an alternating current supply comprising an inverter for each coil and a control unit providing in-phase and out-of-phase switching states
column13: Inductive melting apparatus comprising a crucible surrounded by coils (6, 7, 8) has an alternating current supply comprising an inverter (22, 23, 24) for each coil and a control unit (28) providing two switching states: a first state for in-phase current supply and a second state for out-of-phase current supply.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT;;RENNER WOLFGANG

column12: METHOD AND DEVICE FOR DRYING WOOD
column13: According to the invention, wood is dielectrically heated in a vacuum chamber by a high frequency field which penetrates said wood. The vacuum chamber and all of the parts located in said chamber are kept at a higher temperature than that of the wood. Once the atmosphere in the vacuum chamber is saturated with water vapour, said water vapour is condensed in a separate evacuated condensation chamber. The inventive device for carrying out this method has a vacuum chamber (17) wherein electrodes (4) are arranged for applying a high frequency electrical field to the wood to be dried. A heating system (2) is allocated to the wall of the vacuum chamber (17). A condensation chamber (9) is also provided, said condensation chamber being connected to the vacuum chamber (17) by a line (7) which can be blocked off by a valve (8).
column14: WOLF SYSTEMBAU GMBH & CO KG;;WOLF JOHANN;;FUCHS HERBERT

column12: Process and devices for producing decorated ceramic mouldings
column13: A decorative substance is applied to a pressure diaphragm. Subsequently a tight edge seal is produced between the pressure diaphragm and a first mould part and the air is sucked, via channels, out of the space enclosed by the pressure diaphragm and the first mould part, causing the pressure diaphragm to lie against the first mould part and transferring the decorative substance to said first mould part. Then the pressure diaphragm is removed and from the first mould part and at least one second mould part there is formed a filling chamber, which is also evacuated and then filled with pourable ceramic composition. The composition is finally pressed to form a moulding, the decorative substance being transferred thereto. For evacuating the filling chamber, the same channels are used via which the pressure diaphragm was previously sucked against the first mould part.
column15: FUCHS GERHARD;;PAANS HERBERT

column12: Friction welding with vacuum-tight annular weld seams - between ferritic body with annular groove and light metal body
column13: The ferritic body has >=1 annular groove 0.3-0.5 mm deep coaxial with its axis of rotation, in the region of the seam to be formed, while the light metal body has a flat surface. The cross-section of the annular groove may be consine-shaped, or the bottom of the groove may be flat and the groove flanks cosine-shaped. Welding is performed with materials which are pref. heated to above room temp. The strength of the resulting weld seams extends as far as the material strength of the light metal body, with good properties of flow between the two materials.

column12: Eyeglass frame
column13: A hinge connecting a bow (1) to a rim-side bow carrier (3) of a spectacle frame comprises is formed on said bow carrier (3) with an abutment surface, which faces the bow (1), which is formed with a pocket (7) that is open on the inside surface of the bow. The hinge bracket 5 is provided with stub pins, which constitute a pivot and are pivoted in bearing sockets (8) formed in the pocket (7). Grooves (9) extend from the bearing sockets, (8) to the inside surface of the bow and are tapered toward said bearing sockets (8) in depth or width so that the stub pins are a snap-action fit in the bearing sockets. To prevent an unintended separation of the bow from the bow carrier, the grooves extend from the bearing sockets on that side thereof which is opposite to a terminal edge (10), with which the bow engages the abutment surface (4) of the bow carrier (3) to define an open position for the bow.

column12: METHOD FOR CONVERTING THERMAL ENERGY INTO ELECTRIC ENERGY
column13: The invention relates to an apparatus for converting thermal energy into electric energy, comprising at least one thermocouple, wherein the thermocouples has two thermobranches (A, B) connected electrically in series and wherein the thermocouple has a first passage surface (F 1 ) and a second passage surface (F) for the heat flow (Q) and/or for the electric current (7, 7'). According to the invention, the value of the first passage surface (F 1 ) is smaller than 5% of the value of the second passage surface (F).

column12: TOOTHBRUSH ATTACHMENT AND METHOD FOR THE PRODUCTION THEREOF.
column13: The present invention relates to a toothbrush attachment for an electric toothbrush, having a preferably tube-shaped body part on which an electronic module, such as a transponder, is mounted. The invention further relates to a method for producing such a toothbrush attachment and to a toothbrush having such a toothbrush attachment. According to the invention, the at least one electronic component is welded into the toothbrush attachment. According to the invention, the electronic component is encapsulated in an intermediate space between two body parts of the toothbrush attachment and is closed by at least one weld seam bonding the two body parts to each other. This ensures comprehensive protection of the electronic component by the body parts covering it.
column15: MAJTHAN RUDOLF;;FUCHS HANS-HERBERT

column12: Zahnbürstenaufsatzteil sowie Verfahren zu seiner Herstellung
column13: Die vorliegende Erfindung betrifft ein Zahnbürstenaufsatzteil für eine elektrische Zahnbürste, mit einem vorzugsweise rohrförmigen Korpusteil, an dem ein Elektronikbaustein, beispielsweise ein Transponder, befestigt ist. Die Erfindung betrifft weiterhin ein Verfahren zur Herstellung eines solchen Zahnbürstenaufsatzteiles sowie eine Zahnbürste mit einem solchen Zahnbürstenaufsatzteil. Es wird vorgeschlagen, den zumindest einen Elektronikbaustein an dem Zahnbürstenaufsatzteil einzuschweißen. Erfindungsgemäß ist der Elektronikbaustein in einem Zwischenraum zwischen zwei Korpusteilen des Zahnbürstenaufsatzteiles eingekapselt, der durch zumindest eine die beiden Korpusteile stoffschlüssig miteinander verbindende Schweißnaht verschlossen ist. Ein aufwendiges Eingießen, das zwar grundsätzlich zusätzlich zum genannten Einschweißen möglich wäre, kann entfallen, wodurch die entsprechenden zeitaufwendigen Fertigungsschritte des Umgießens eingespart werden können. Dabei wird ein umfassender Schutz des Elektronikbausteins durch die ihn abdeckenden Korpusteile gewährleistet.
column15: MAJTHAN RUDOLF;;FUCHS HANS-HERBERT

column12: DATA LOADING PROCESS
column13: PURPOSE: A data loading process is disclosed for coupling a supplementary system (ZAS) to an automation total system (ABS) provided with a basic system (BAS). CONSTITUTION: The contents of the main memory (HSB) of the basic system (BAS) are transmitted by reading and writing them section by section into the main memory (HSB) of the supplementary system (ZAS). While the data are read section by section and written out of or into the main memory (HSB) of the basic system (BAS), the same data are written into a temporary memory (ZSB) and transmitted from the temporary memory (ZSB) to the main memory (HSB) of the supplementary system (ZAS).
column15: BARTHEL HERBERT;;FUCHS HEINER;;GVEL ALFONS

column13: The present invention provides an optical sensor supporting structure for a saddled vehicle capable of accurately detecting a front of the vehicle by an optical sensor without affecting usability of accessories at a front portion of the vehicle. The optical sensor supporting structure for a saddled vehicle includes left and right cameras which are configured to detect an object in front of the vehicle, and a support stay which is fixed to a head pipe of a vehicle body frame and supports accessories at the front of the vehicle on the head pipe, wherein the left and right cameras are supported by the support stay.

column12: Apparatus for picking the shuttles of a loom
column13: An apparatus for picking or firing a projectile-like shuttle contains a pair of rolls revolving at a relatively high rotational speed. The rolls of the roll pair can be simultaneously brought into contact with a related shuttle in order to accelerate the same by frictional forces. To that end the rolls are each arranged upon a pivotal arm and operatively connected with a control arrangement. The rolls possess a predetermined elasticity such that their radial springiness or resilient yielding action at least approximately linearly increases as a function of the increasing radial contact pressure upon bringing the rolls into contact with the shuttles. These measures ensure for a practically wear-free, absolutely precise and controllable mode of operation of the apparatus.

column12: VORRICHTUNG ZUR UMWANDLUNG VON WÄRMEENERGIE IN ELEKTRISCHE ENERGIE

Dabei ist vorgesehen, dass der Wert der ersten Durchtrittsfläche (F1) kleiner ist als 5 % des Werts der zweiten Durchtrittsfläche (F).

L'INVENTION CONCERNE UN DISPOSITIF POUR PROPULSER LA NAVETTE D'UN METIER A TISSER.

CE DISPOSITIF POUR PROPULSER UNE NAVETTE EN FORME DE PROJECTILE 1 POSSEDE UN COUPLE DE ROULEAUX 2, 3 TOURNANT A VITESSE ASSEZ ELEVEE ET QUI PEUVENT ETRE SERRES SIMULTANEMENT CONTRE LA NAVETTE 1 EN VUE D'ACCELERER CETTE DERNIERE. column12: GAS TURBINE AND METHOD FOR ITS OPERATION
column13: A gas turbine and method are disclosed by which the gas turbine can be safely operated at nominal speed with reduced margin to a surge limit of a compressor. The gas turbine, via a directly driven generator which generates alternating current with an operating frequency and which is connected in a frequency-coupled manner to an electricity grid, can deliver electric power to this grid. In the case of an underfrequency event the compressor of the gas turbine is unloaded by controlled, fast closing of the variable compressor guide vanes (VGV) and as a result maintains a sufficient margin to the surge limit of the compressor.

column12: Synchronisation process
column13: A synchronization method for a redundant automation system composed of at least two subsystems is provided, where these subsystems execute functionally identical sequences of machine instructions, said sequences of functionally identical machine instructions having increment instructions at corresponding locations for incrementing a synchronization counter. Synchronization is performed on the basis of the value of a synchronization counter at least when one subsystem registers a special event. To do so, a synchronization counter target value is determined so that the subsystems interrupt the execution of the sequence of machine instructions on attaining a synchronization position at which the values of the respective synchronization counters attain the synchronization counter target value.

column12: GAS TURBINE AND METHOD FOR THE OPERATION THEREOF
column13: The invention relates to a gas turbine (12) which can be safely operated at a nominal rotation speed with a reduced margin in relation to the surge limit of the compressor, and to a method for the operation of this gas turbine. The gas turbine (12) delivers electric power to an electric network (21) via a directly driven generator (18) which is frequency-coupled to and connected to the network and produces alternating current at an operating frequency. In the event of a frequency drop, the pressure in the compressor (13) of the gas turbine (12) is relieved by a controlled, rapid closing of the adjustable compressor vanes, maintaining a sufficient margin in relation to the surge limit of the compressor.

column12: Method for cooling a gas turbine plant and gas turbine plant for implementing the method
column13: A method is provided for operating a gas turbine plant, in which compressed air is extracted from a compressor and for cooling is directed in an internal cooling passage through thermally loaded components to the combustion chamber and/or to the turbine, then re-cooled, and added to the compressor main flow in the compressor. At least a portion of the recirculated air is supersaturated, or partially saturated, with drops of water during or before recirculation into the compressor and a cooling mist is created. A gas turbine plant is provided with a closed cooling circuit which, for implementing the method, includes an injection arrangement for introducing water into the recirculated cooling air.

column12: METHOD FOR MANUFACTURING PUNCHED COMPONENT
column13: To reduce a difference in shape between the workpiece surface plane of a sag side and the workpiece surface plane of a burr side of a workpiece manufactured by punching or fine blanking, and most preferably, completely remove it.SOLUTION: The present invention is characterized as follows: a workpiece (W1) being punched, particularly subjected to fine blanking, is inserted in an embossing machine; the burr (G) generated in the workpiece (W1) is subjected to fillet processing in punching by the die (GS) of the embossing machine; and the height of the sag (E) caused in punching is also reduced by the same stroke of the embossing machine (GS) performing the fillet processing of the burr, in a method for manufacturing a punched component (W2), particularly a transmission disk plate or the workpiece with teeth, particularly gears.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 4A

column12: Gas discharge tube.
column13: Im Entladungsgefäß (1) einer Gasentladungsröhre ist ein Verdrängerrohr (2) vorgesehen, das sich über die gesamte Länge des rohrförmigen Entladungsgefäßes (1), das einen mittleren, gegenüber seinen Enden (8) durchmesserklei­neren Abschnitt aufweist, erstreckt, und mit den endsei­tigen Stirnwänden (3) des Entladungsgefäßes (1), gasdicht verbunden ist, wobei zwischen dem durchmesserkleineren Abschnitt des Entladungsgefäßes (1) und dem Verdränger­rohr (2) ein ringspaltförmiger Raum (7) mit einer Stärke von 1,0 bis 1,5 mm vorgesehen ist. Im Inneren des Ver­drängerrohres (2) sind mehrere Magnete (12) so angeord­net, daß sich im ringspaltförmigen Raum (7) vorwiegend radial verlaufende, abwechselnd entgegengesetzt gerichte­te Feldlinienmuster ergeben, die dazu führen, daß sich die Ladungsträger in gekrümmten Bahnen bewegen, was zu einer höheren Strahlungsdichte führt.

column12: Fibre-reinforced membrane for separating two chambers with different pressures - has comparatively high breaking tension with raised modulus to reduce proportion of fibrous material.
column13: The membrane (10) has a breaking tension of more than 50 % and less than 150%. The tension value with an extension of 50% is greater than 5 N/ mm2. The membrane has a hardness between 60 and 90 Shore "A". Highly tensile synthetic fibres and/or carbon fibres are used as the short fibres which are embedded in the elastomer. These short fibres can be made from aromatic polyamide, are fibrillated, with their length between 0.8 and 1. 5 mm. The ratio of fibre length to fibre dia. of the short fibres is about 100. USE/ADVANTAGE - Improved mechanical strength and simplified mfr. of fibre-reinforced membrane for sepg. two chambers with different pressures.

column12: Flüssigkeitsgekühlter Widerstand
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft einen flüssigkeitsgekühlten Widerstand (100), bei dem mindestens ein elektrisch leitendes Widerstandselement (101) in einem Kühlkanal (K) angeordnet ist. Der Hohlraum (RS) um das Widerstandselement im Kühlkanal hat dabei eine geringe Dicke (Δ) und/oder das Widerstandselement befindet sich gegenüber dem Kühlkanal in einer elektrischen Isolierung (102). column12: Method for Producing Stamped Parts
column13: The present invention relates to a method for producing stamped parts (W2), in which a stamped, particularly, precisely blanked workpiece (W1) is inserted in an embossing device and burr (G) formed on the workpiece (W1) during stamping is rounded through a die (GS) of the embossing device, and particularly, to a method for producing transmission disks or workpieces including teeth, especially gear wheels. The height of rollover (E) formed during the stamping is reduced by using the same stroke of the embossing device (GS) that performs burr rounding. Therefore, a geometrical difference between the die roll side surface and the burr side surface of a stamped or precisely blanked workpiece can be reduced.

column12: GAS TURBINE AND METHOD FOR THE OPERATION THEREOF
column13: The invention relates to a gas turbine (12) which can be safely operated at a nominal rotation speed with a reduced margin in relation to the surge limit of the compressor, and to a method for the operation of this gas turbine. The gas turbine (12) delivers electric power to an electric network (21) via a directly driven generator (18) which is frequency-coupled to and connected to the network and produces alternating current at an operating frequency. In the event of a frequency drop, the pressure in the compressor (13) of the gas turbine (12) is relieved by a controlled, rapid closing of the adjustable compressor vanes, maintaining a sufficient margin in relation to the surge limit of the compressor.

Um einen kostengünstigen und im Normalbetrieb verschleißarmen Notantrieb bereitzustellen, wird vorgeschlagen, dass der Notantrieb (44) über eine Kupplung (32) mit der Wickelwelle (12) verbunden ist, wobei die Kupplung (12) durch die Betätigung des Notantriebes (44) last- oder bewegungsgesteuert in eine Schließstellung schaltbar ist und sich bei einem lastfreien Notantrieb (44) in einer geöffneten Stellung befindet.

column12: Gear pump, particularly external gear pump has two combing gears made of a sintered material, particularly sintered steel, whose surface has friction-reducing coating
column13: The gear pump (10) has two combing gears made of a sintered material, particularly sintered steel, whose surface has a friction-reducing coating. The sintered material of the gear wheels has pores uncovered by grinding. The friction-reducing coating is anchored in form-fit manner in the pores. The friction-reducing coating is a sliding lacquer layer. The sliding lacquer layer additionally contains a cross linking agent. The friction-reducing coating is a manganese phosphate layer. An independent claim is also included for a method for manufacturing a gear pump.

column12: Adjusting device for objects to be printed by the screen printing method
column13: The adjusting device (26) comprises a horizontal base (54) for an object (10) whose upper end face (14) and lower end face, resting on the base (54), are not precisely parallel. The base (54) can be lifted by means of a lifting drive (40) and rotated by means of a rotary drive (50) about a vertical central axis (A). Arranged above the base (54) and offset relative to the central axis (A) is at least one push button (82) which can be actuated when the object (10) is lifted, regardless of the position of the upper end face (14). The push button (82) is switched such that, when it has been actuated, it causes the rotary drive (50) to rotate through an angle depending on the position of the actuated push button (82). The dependence is fixed so that the inclination of the upper end face (14) of the object (10) maintains a direction which extends transversely to the longitudinal direction of the conveyor (20) and is consequently harmless when the upper end face (14) is subsequently printed by a screen printing device which has a doctor blade which can be moved back and forth in the longitudinal direction of the conveyor (20). <IMAGE>

column12: METHOD FOR COOLING A GAS TURBINE PLANT AND GAS TURBINE PLANT FOR IMPLEMENTING THE METHOD
column13: A method is provided for operating a gas turbine plant, in which compressed air is extracted from a compressor and for cooling is directed in an internal cooling passage through thermally loaded components to the combustion chamber and/or to the turbine, then re-cooled, and added to the compressor main flow in the compressor. At least a portion of the recirculated air is supersaturated, or partially saturated, with drops of water during or before recirculation into the compressor and a cooling mist is created. A gas turbine plant is provided with a closed cooling circuit which, for implementing the method, includes an injection arrangement for introducing water into the recirculated cooling air.

column12: Method for cooling gas turbine plant, involves sucking input side inlet air by compressor of gas turbine plant, where compressor compresses inlet air to output side compressor end air
column13: The method involves sucking input side inlet air by a compressor (1) of the gas turbine plant. The compressor compresses the inlet air to output side compressor end air (14). A fuel is burnt in a combustion chamber (2) to form hot gas (15) by using the compressor end air. The hot gas is expanded in a turbine (3). A portion of the re-cooled air is over saturated or partially saturated with water drops at or before recirculation in the compressor and a cooling mist is generated. An independent claim is included for a gas turbine plant with a spray cooler.

column12: DATA LOADING PROCESS
column13: A data loading process is disclosed for coupling a supplementary system (ZAS) to an automation total system (ABS) provided with a basic system (BAS). The contents of the main memory (HSB) of the basic system (BAS) are transmitted by reading and writing them section by section into the main memory (HSB) of the supplementary system (ZAS). While the data are read section by section and written out of or into the main memory (HSB) of the basic system (BAS), the same data are written into a temporary memory (ZSB) and transmitted from the temporary memory (ZSB) to the main memory (HSB) of the supplementary system (ZAS).

column12: OPTICAL SENSOR SUPPORTING STRUCTURE FOR SADDLED VEHICLES
column13: The present invention provides an optical sensor supporting structure for a saddled vehicle capable of accurately detecting a front of the vehicle by an optical sensor without affecting usability of accessories at a front portion of the vehicle. The optical sensor supporting structure for a saddled vehicle includes left and right cameras which are configured to detect an object in front of the vehicle, and a support stay which is fixed to a head pipe of a vehicle body frame and supports accessories at the front of the vehicle on the head pipe, wherein the left and right cameras are supported by the support stay.

column12: SYNCHRONIZATION PROCESS
column13: PURPOSE: Disclosed is a synchronization process for an automation system of redundant construction consisting of at least two partial systems which, to control a process, perform functionally identical sequences of machine commands which have instrumentation instructions at mutually corresponding positions to increment a synchronization counter. CONSTITUTION: A synchronization process for an automation system(1) includes at least two partial systems(2,2'). The two partial systems(2,2') is performed functionally identical sequences of machine commands(MP) which have instrumentation instructions(IA) at mutually corresponding positions to increment a synchronization counter(SZ,SZ') in order to control a process. Synchronization takes place using the value of a synchronization counter(SZ,SZ') at least when a partial system(2,2') records a special event(11). To this end a synchronization counter target(SZZ) is found so that the partial systems(2,2') interrupt the execution of the sequence of machine commands(MP) at which the values of the synchronization counter(SZ,SZ') reach the synchronization counter target(SZZ).
column15: BARTHEL HERBERT;;FUCHS HEINER;;GVEL ALFONS

column12: PROCEDIMIENTO DE SINCRONIZACION.
column13: A synchronization method for a redundant automation system composed of at least two subsystems is provided, where these subsystems execute functionally identical sequences of machine instructions, said sequences of functionally identical machine instructions having increment instructions at corresponding locations for incrementing a synchronization counter. Synchronization is performed on the basis of the value of a synchronization counter at least when one subsystem registers a special event. To do so, a synchronization counter target value is determined so that the subsystems interrupt the execution of the sequence of machine instructions on attaining a synchronization position at which the values of the respective synchronization counters attain the synchronization counter target value.

Schritt wird das Tracking-System (3) In einer zweiten Position positioniert. Anschließend werden der 3. Schritt und der 4. Schritt erneut durchgeführt.

column13: Verfahren zum Kühlen einer Gasturbinenanlage (10), umfassend einen Verdichter (1), welcher eingangsseitig Ansaugluft (4) ansaugt und zu ausgangsseitig zur Verfügung stehender Verdichterendluft (14) verdichtet, eine Brennkammer (2), in welcher unter Verwendung der Verdichterendluft (14) ein Brennstoff (20) unter Bildung von Heissgas (15) verbrannt wird, sowie eine Turbine (3), in welcher das Heissgas (15) unter Arbeitsleistung entspannt wird, bei welchem Verfahren verdichtete Luft aus dem Verdichter (1) entnommen, als Kühlluft zur Kühlung in einem innenliegenden Kühlkanal durch thermisch belastete Bauteile der Brennkammer (2) und/oder der Turbine (3) geleitet, anschliessend rückgekühlt und dem Verdichterhauptstrom im Verdichter (1) zugefügt wird, wobei zumindest ein Teil der rückgekühlten Luft bei oder vor der Rückführung in den Verdichter (1) mit Wassertropfen übersättigt oder teilgesättigt wird und ein Kühlnebel (37, 38, 39) erzeugt wird, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass. Wasser (6) und rückgeführte Luft in mindestens eine Verdichterleitschaufel (7) eingeführt werden, diese in Strömungsrichtung hintereinander in die Verdichterströmung eingeführt werden und an der Schaufeloberfläche zur Erzeugung eines Kühlnebels (37, 38, 39) vermischt werden.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT;;NEMET ANTON;;WETTSTEIN HANS
column16: ANSALDO ENERGIA SWITZERLAND AG, CH (2017-10-23);;GENERAL ELECTRIC TECHNOLOGY GMBH, CH (2016-08-09)

column12: Verfahren zum Kühlen einer Gasturbinenanlage sowie Gasturbinenanlage zur Durchführung des Verfahrens.
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft ein Verfahren zum Betrieb einer Gasturbinenanlage (10), bei welchem verdichtete Luft aus einem Verdichter (1) entnommen und zur Kühlung in einem innenliegenden Kühlkanal durch thermisch belastete Bauteile (31, 32, 33) der Brennkammer (2) und/oder der Turbine (3) geleitet wird, anschliessend rückgekühlt und dem Verdichterhauptstrom im Verdichter (1) zugefügt wird. Das Verfahren zeichnet sich dadurch aus, dass zumindest ein Teil der rückgekühlten Luft bei oder vor der Rückführung in den Verdichter (1) mit Wassertropfen übersättigt oder teilgesättigt wird und ein Kühlnebel (37, 38, 39) erzeugt wird. Weiter betrifft die Erfindung eine Gasturbinenanlage (10) mit geschlossenem Kühlkreislauf, die zur Durchführung des Verfahrens eine Einspritzanordnung zur Einleitung von Wasser (6) in rückgeführte Kühlluft umfasst.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT;;NEMET ANTON;;WETTSTEIN HANS E

column12: Power supply for diagnostic probe - has AC connection from DC supply via fixed bias coupling
column13: The power supply for a diagnostic probe has an AC connection from the control box to the probe and with an AC/DC converter in the probe to generate the DC monitoring signals. The connection is via a fixed bias line. The system allows a controlled power supply with suitable decoupling to prevent injury to the patient and without any losses, as with DC transmission. The AC/DC converter operates identical to one in the power supply, while the signal is transmitted by a frequency controlled signal on the AC supply.
column15: KESSLER MANFRED PROF DR MED;;FUCHS HERBERT

column12: GAS DISCHARGE TUBE
column13: Im Entladungsgefäß (1) einer Gasentladungsröhre ist ein Verdrängerrohr (2) vorgesehen, das sich über die gesamte Länge des rohrförmigen Entladungsgefäßes (1), das einen mittleren, gegenüber seinen Enden (8) durchmesserklei­neren Abschnitt aufweist, erstreckt, und mit den endsei­tigen Stirnwänden (3) des Entladungsgefäßes (1), gasdicht verbunden ist, wobei zwischen dem durchmesserkleineren Abschnitt des Entladungsgefäßes (1) und dem Verdränger­rohr (2) ein ringspaltförmiger Raum (7) mit einer Stärke von 1,0 bis 1,5 mm vorgesehen ist. Im Inneren des Ver­drängerrohres (2) sind mehrere Magnete (12) so angeord­net, daß sich im ringspaltförmigen Raum (7) vorwiegend radial verlaufende, abwechselnd entgegengesetzt gerichte­te Feldlinienmuster ergeben, die dazu führen, daß sich die Ladungsträger in gekrümmten Bahnen bewegen, was zu einer höheren Strahlungsdichte führt.
column15: FUCHS, HERBERT, C/O VECTOR RELATED PHYSICS

Der Temperaturregler (15) ist unmittelbar auf dem Wasserrohr (10) verschweißt und steht so in unmittelbarem Wärmekontakt mit diesem.

column12: Electric iron
column13: In an electric iron manufacturing process, in which an aluminium-silicon alloy block is cast together with the heating element and the ironing surface is provided with an aluminium oxide layer, the low silicon-content aluminium sole is fixed in good thermal contact with the block and the aluminium oxide layer is formed on the outer face of the sole by anodising. Preferably, the aluminium oxide layer is 20-80 mu thick and the sole is fixed to the block by means of a temperature resistant silicone adhesive.

column12: INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE AND A METHOD FOR OPERATING AN INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE
column13: Internal combustion engine comprising: - a main combustion chamber (12) comprising at least one intake valve (6) and at least one exhaust valve (7), wherein at least one intake port (10) fluidically connected to an intake manifold is configured to supply an air and/or an air-fuel-mixture to the main combustion chamber (12) via the at least one intake valve (6), and - a pre-chamber (4) which is in fluid connection with the main combustion chamber (12), wherein the pre-chamber (4) is in fluid connection with the intake port (10) and/or the intake manifold through a supply line (9), wherein at least one fuel injector (18) is arranged in the intake port and/or in the intake manifold (10) and/or in the main combustion chamber (12) in such a way that the air and/or air-fuel-mixture supplied to the main combustion chamber (12) can be enriched to have a lower ignition delay than an air-fuel-mixture supplied to the pre-chamber (4) and/or air or air-fuel-mixture can be supplied to the pre-chamber (4) to have a higher ignition delay than an air-fuel- mixture supplied to the main combustion chamber (12). The lower ignition delay can be achieved by providing different fuels (e.g. hydrogen in main combustion chamber) or lower air/fuel-ratio lambda in main combustion chamber.
column15: SPYRA NIKOLAUS;;SCHAUMBERGER HERBERT;;FUCHS JOCHEN;;FIMML WOLFGANG

column12: GASTURBINE UND VERFAHREN ZU DEREN BETRIEB.
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft eine Gasturbine(12), die bei nomineller Drehzahl mit reduziertem Abstand zur Pumpgrenze des Verdichters sicher betrieben werden kann, sowie ein Verfahren zum Betrieb dieser Gasturbine. Die Gasturbine (12) liefert über einem direkt angetriebenen, Wechselstrom mit einer Betriebsfrequenz erzeugenden Generator (18), der frequenzgekoppelt an ein elektrisches Netz (21) angeschlossen ist, elektrische Leistung an dies Netz (21). Im Fall eines Unterfrequenzereignisses wird der Verdichter (13) der Gasturbine(12) durch kontrolliertes, schnelles Schliessen der verstellbaren Verdichterleitschaufeln (VGV) entlastet und dadurch ein ausreichender Abstand zur Pumpgrenze des Verdichters erhalten.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT;;NEMET ANTON DR;;HOFFMANN JUERGEN DR

column12: PREDICTIVE SUSPENSION CONTROL FOR A VEHICLE USING A STEREO CAMERA SENSOR
column13: Embodiments of the invention address the area of predictive suspension control system for a vehicle, particularly a two-wheel vehicle such as a motor cycle or a scooter. The system includes a stereo sensor unit which for generating image data, a computing unit which extracts a relevant image portion from the image data based on future vehicle path data, and calculates road unevenness on a future vehicle path of the vehicle based on the generated image data. A suspension control unit generates an adaptation signal for adapting the suspension based on the calculated road unevenness. The computing unit adapts a search direction of a stereo algorithm or a correlation area of the stereo algorithm based on a lean angle of the vehicle to generate the three-dimensional partial image data from the relevant image portion, and fits a road model to the three-dimensional partial image data to calculate the road unevenness.
column15: DEIGMÖLLER JÖRG;;EINECKE NILS;;JANSSEN HERBERT;;FUCHS OLIVER

column12: PREDICTIVE SUSPENSION CONTROL FOR VEHICLE USING STEREO CAMERA SENSOR
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To address the area of predictive suspension control systems for a vehicle, particularly a two-wheel vehicle such as a motor cycle or a scooter.SOLUTION: The system for adapting a suspension 6 includes: a stereo sensor unit 2 which generates image data; and a computing unit 4 which extracts a relevant image portion from the image data based on future vehicle path data, and calculates changes in road unevenness on a future vehicle path of the vehicle based on the generated image data. A suspension control unit 5 generates an adaptation signal for adapting the suspension based on the changes in the calculated road unevenness. The computing unit adapts a search direction of a stereo algorithm or a correlation area of the stereo algorithm based on a tilt angle of the vehicle to generate three-dimensional partial image data from the relevant image portion, and fits a road model to the three-dimensional partial image data to calculate the changes in the road unevenness.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: Strain gage having a thin discontinuous metal layer
column13: A highly sensitive strain gage containing a thin discontinuous metal layer whose conduction effect is based predominantly on the tunnel effect and which is applied uniformly onto a thin, nonmetallic, dielectric or semiconducting substrate such as uniaxially oriented or partially crystalline plastic film, an ordered ultrathin layer or a silicone-coated plastic film, the diffusion processes in the applied metal layer being reduced and its structural stability improved as a result of interaction of the substrate with the metal layer.

column12: VERFAHREN ZUM LOKALEN ERWÄRMEN VON GEGENSTÄNDEN
column13: In a method for local heating of articles (1) with electromagnetic (EM) radiation, with simultaneous cooling of the immediate environment of the heated region by a fluid stream (2), the fluid stream and the EM radiation directed towards the heated region (4) are guided via completely spatially separated pathways. Independent claims are included for: (1) corresponding local heating apparatus, comprising an EM radiation source (10), a housing (11) opening towards the article to be heated, a channel (12) in the housing for guiding the radiation towards the article and a channel (13) between the housing and radiation guiding channel for fluid transported by a pump, ventilator or the like, where at least one housing wall perpendicular to the housing opening (16) has opening(s) (15) into the fluid channel (13); (2) a toothbrush head with at least two independently movable sections mounted in sprung manner in a connecting region on one end of the head, running in a V-shape initial configuration relative to each other, which on heating in the connecting region and applying mechanical force to the open end followed by cooling are converted into the final head contour with a constant width slot between the section, the novel feature being that the connecting region is heated by the above method; and (3) a toothbrush with a head as above.
column15: FUCHS HANS-HERBERT;;MAJTHAN RUDOLF;;FIRATLI AHMET CEM

column12: Video-based warning system for a vehicle
column13: The present invention proposes a warning system that can be implemented in any kind of vehicle, in order to efficiently detect moving objects. The system utilizes at least one camera for a continuous imaging of the surroundings of the vehicle. Thereby, moving objects can be monitored. A computing unit is programmed to estimate a motion of any moving object based on a pixel motion in the camera image. If a dangerously moving object is detected, a warning unit can be used for issuing a warning signal. To take such a decision, the estimated motion of at least one of the moving objects can be correlated or compared to predetermined motion patterns.
column15: DEIGMOELLER JOERG;;EGGERT JULIAN;;JANSSEN HERBERT;;FUCHS OLIVER

column12: Bit pattern test procedure for computer
column13: The method comprises the steps of reading the bit patterns of each memory space of a memory which comprises a number of sequentially arranged memory spaces that store information, such as a program code, and adding the bit patterns to form an actual check sum. An actual parallel signature is formed corresponding to the bit patterns contained in the memory spaces. The stored information is considered error free, only if the determined actual check sum coincides with a previously detected and stored reference check sum, and if the determined actual parallel signature coincides with a previously detected and stored reference signature. The actual check sum is pref. determined in a calculation unit that comprises the double amount of bits w.r.t. the bits of each memory space.
column15: BARTHEL HERBERT DIPL ING;;FUCHS HEINER DIPL ING

column12: VERFAHREN ZUR HERSTELLUNG EINER GASENTLADUNGSLICHTQUELLE UND GASENTLADUNGSRÖHRE.
column13: A method for producing a gas discharge light source for emitting an electromagnetic radiation comprising a gas discharge tube filled with at least one discharge gas material and having a means for generating a gas discharge includes the following method steps: igniting the gas discharge tube filled with the discharge gas material, performing a forming operation in which the electrical operating power of the gas discharge light source is at least as high as the desired continuous operation power, the gas discharge tube is held at a temperature which is at least as high as the subsequent operating temperature, the intensity of the emitted electromagnetic radiation in the region of the desired wavelengths is monitored and the partial pressure of the vaporized discharge gas material is varied until the intensity of the selected electromagnetic radiation has reached a maximum value, whereupon a reservoir with excess discharge gas material is separated from the gas discharge tube in such a manner that the gas discharge tube under operating conditions does not contain any condensed discharge gas material. A gas discharge tube having a discharge material forming a discharge gas under operating conditions is distinguished in that the discharge gas material is incorporated in the inner wall of the gas discharge tube and there is no longer any condensed discharge gas material in the gas discharge tube.
column15: FUCHS HERBERT KARL;;M B H CO KG

column12: Method for local heating of objects
column13: In a method for local heating of articles (1) with electromagnetic (EM) radiation, with simultaneous cooling of the immediate environment of the heated region by a fluid stream (2), the fluid stream and the EM radiation directed towards the heated region (4) are guided via completely spatially separated pathways. Independent claims are included for: (1) corresponding local heating apparatus, comprising an EM radiation source (10), a housing (11) opening towards the article to be heated, a channel (12) in the housing for guiding the radiation towards the article and a channel (13) between the housing and radiation guiding channel for fluid transported by a pump, ventilator or the like, where at least one housing wall perpendicular to the housing opening (16) has opening(s) (15) into the fluid channel (13); (2) a toothbrush head with at least two independently movable sections mounted in sprung manner in a connecting region on one end of the head, running in a V-shape initial configuration relative to each other, which on heating in the connecting region and applying mechanical force to the open end followed by cooling are converted into the final head contour with a constant width slot between the section, the novel feature being that the connecting region is heated by the above method; and (3) a toothbrush with a head as above.
column15: FUCHS HANS-HERBERT;;MAJTHAN RUDOLF;;FIRATLI AHMET CEM

column12: VIDEO-BASED WARNING SYSTEM FOR VEHICLE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To efficiently detect moving objects in a warning system that can be implemented in any kind of vehicle.SOLUTION: The system comprises at least one camera for a continuous imaging of the surroundings of the vehicle, thereby monitoring moving objects. The system also comprises a computing unit programmed to calculate a motion of any moving object on the basis of a pixel motion in the camera image. The system further comprises a warning unit for issuing a warning signal upon detection of a dangerous moving object. To make this determination, the calculated motion of at least one of the moving objects is correlated or compared to predetermined motion patterns.

column12: INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE AND A METHOD FOR OPERATING AN INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE
column13: Internal combustion engine comprising: - a main combustion chamber (12) comprising at least one intake valve (6) and at least one exhaust valve (7), wherein at least one intake port (10) fluidically connected to an intake manifold is configured to supply an air and/or an air-fuel-mixture to the main combustion chamber (12) via the at least one intake valve (6), and - a pre-chamber (4) which is in fluid connection with the main combustion chamber (12), wherein the pre-chamber (4) is in fluid connection with the intake port (10) and/or the intake manifold through a supply line (9), wherein at least one fuel injector (18) is arranged in the intake port and/or in the intake manifold (10) and/or in the main combustion chamber (12) in such a way that the air and/or air-fuel-mixture supplied to the main combustion chamber (12) can be enriched to have a lower ignition delay than an air-fuel-mixture supplied to the pre-chamber (4) and/or air or air-fuel-mixture can be supplied to the pre-chamber (4) to have a higher ignition delay than an air-fuel- mixture supplied to the main combustion chamber (12). The lower ignition delay can be achieved by providing different fuels (e.g. hydrogen in main combustion chamber) or lower air/fuel-ratio lambda in main combustion chamber.

column12: Verfahren zur Ermittlung eines Fremdkraftzylinderdruckes
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft ein Verfahren zur Ermittlung eines Fremdkraftzylinderdruckes (pF) einer Fremdkraftbremsanlage (1). Das Verfahren umfasst dabei die Schritte des Ermittelns (A) wenigstens eines Motorwertes (MM) eines Fremdkraftzylindermotors (20), des Ermittelns (B) eines potentiellen Fremdkraftzylinderdrucks (pF) aus dem Motorwert (MM), anhand eines Korrelationsmodels (pF(MM)) zwischen Motorwert (MM) und potentiellen Fremdkraftzylinderdruck (pF), und des Ermittelns (C) eines Fremdkraftzylinderdrucks (pESP) mittels eines ESP-Drucksensors (36) im ESP Bremssystem (8). Darüber hinaus umfasst das Verfahren die Schritte des Vergleichs (D) des potentiellen Fremdkraftzylinderdruck (pF) mit dem Fremdkraftzylinderdruck (pESP) des ESP-Drucksensors (36) unter Einbeziehung einer Zeitverzögerung (tv) zwischen potentiellen Fremdkraftzylinderdruck (pF) und gemessenen Fremdkraftzylinderdrucks (pESP) des ESP-Drucksensors (36), und der Korrektur (E) des Korrelationsmodels (pF(MM)) entsprechend einer ermittelten Abweichung (Δp).

column12: METHOD FOR DETERMINING A POWER-ASSISTED CYLINDER PRESSURE
column13: The invention relates to a method for determining a corrected potential power-assisted cylinder pressure (p F ) of a power-assisted brake system (1). The method comprises the steps of determining (A) at least one motor value (M M ) of a power-assisted cylinder motor (20), determining (B) a potential power-assisted cylinder pressure (p F ) from the motor value (M M ) on the basis of a correlation model (p F (M M )) between the motor value (M M ) and potential power-assisted cylinder pressure (p F ), and determining (C) a power-assisted cylinder pressure (p ESP ) by means of an ESP pressure sensor (36) in the ESP brake system (8). Furthermore, the method comprises the steps of comparing (D) the potential power-assisted cylinder pressure (p F ) with the power-assisted cylinder pressure (p ESP ) of the ESP pressure sensor (36) with the inclusion of a time delay (tv) between the potential power-assisted cylinder pressure (p F ) and measured power-assisted cylinder pressure (p ESP ) of the ESP pressure sensor (36), and correcting (E) the correlation model (p F (M M )) in accordance with a determined deviation (Δp).

column12: Predictive suspension control for a vehicle using a stereo camera sensor
column13: Embodiments of the invention address the area of predictive suspension control system for a vehicle, particularly a two-wheel vehicle such as a motor cycle or a scooter. The system includes a stereo sensor unit which for generating image data, a computing unit which extracts a relevant image portion from the image data based on future vehicle path data, and calculates road unevenness on a future vehicle path of the vehicle based on the generated image data. A suspension control unit generates an adaptation signal for adapting the suspension based on the calculated road unevenness. The computing unit adapts a search direction of a stereo algorithm or a correlation area of the stereo algorithm based on a lean angle of the vehicle to generate the three-dimensional partial image data from the relevant image portion, and fits a road model to the three-dimensional partial image data to calculate the road unevenness.

column12: React time monitoring of a control system
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft ein Verfahren sowie eine Vorrichtung zur Ermittlung mindestens einer Reaktionszeit (24) eines Steuerungssystems (1) sowie Eingangselemente (5), Ausgangselemente (11) oder weitere Komponenten (6 - 10) eines Steuerungssystems (1). Zur Vereinfachung der Ermittlung mindestens einer Reaktionszeit eines Steuerungssystems (1) wird vorgeschlagen, dass die Reaktionszeit (24) aus jeweils einem Eingangselement (5), einem Ausgangselement (11) und weiteren Komponenten (6 -10) des Steuerungssystems (1) zugeordneten Informationen (18) automatisch ermittelt wird, wobei die Reaktionszeit (24) die zwischen dem Erfassen eines Eingangssignals im Eingangselement (5) des Steuerungssystems (1) und der Ausgabe eines durch das Eingangssignal veranlassten Ausgangssignals durch das Ausgangselement (11) des Steuerungssystems (1) verstrichene Zeit umfasst.

column12: DEVICE FOR REMOVING PRECISION PUNCHING RESPECTIVELY FINE BLANKING PARTS FROM A TOOL OF A PRESS
column13: The invention relates to a device for removing parts from a tool of a mechanically or hydraulically driven press. The task of the invention is to provide a device for securely removing parts from the tool of a press, with which it is possible to remove parts from the tool with high surface finish and accuracy at high accelerations and speeds simultaneously saving costs. This task is solved by the direct drive (2) comprising a drive shaft (3) changing the turning direction in dependence of the stroke of the ram, which is pivoting connected to the cross slide (8) via an arm (4), a bracket (5) and a rapid-action coupling for (6) converting the rotating motion into a linear motion, wherein the direction of the linear motion reverses between a front stop position (D) and a rear stop position (C) of the cross slide (8) in the working area (E), and that the cross slide (8) comprises a base plate (27) and a parts plate (26) to take hold of and remove the parts, wherein the parts plate (26) between the rear and front stop positions is guided horizontally movable on rails (28) positioned on the base plate (27).

column12: DEVICE FOR REMOVING PRECISION PUNCHING RESPECTIVELY FINE BLANKING PARTS FROM A TOOL OF A PRESS
column13: A device for removing precision punching respectively fine blanking parts from a tool of a mechanically or hydraulically driven press is provided. The device includes a linked to the ram ( 18 ) of the press ( 14 ) tool part ( 22 ) and a tool part ( 15 ) on the bedplate of the press fixed at the frame of the press, a cross slide ( 8 ) movable transverse to the working direction of the tool parts, which is developed movable into the working area between the tool parts when one of the tool parts opens and out of it to remove the parts ( 21 ) out of the working area when one of the tool parts closes, wherein the cross slide ( 8 ) is connected to a fixed at the frame ( 1 ) of the press direct drive ( 2 ). The direct drive ( 2 ) comprises a drive shaft ( 3 ) changing the turning direction in dependence of the stroke of the ram, which is pivoting connected to the cross slide ( 8 ) via an arm ( 4 ), a bracket ( 5 ) and a rapid-action coupling convert the rotating motion into a linear motion, wherein the direction of the linear motion reverses between a rear stop position (C) and a front stop position (D) of the cross slide ( 8 ) in the working area (E). The cross slide ( 8 ) comprises a base plate ( 27 ) and a parts plate ( 26 ) to take hold of and remove the parts, wherein the parts plate ( 26 ) between the rear and front stop positions is guided horizontally movable on rails ( 28 ) positioned on the base plate ( 27 ).

column12: METHOD OF EJECTING PRECISION PUNCHING MEMBER OR PRECISION SHEARING MEMBER FROM PRESS TOOL
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a method of ejecting a member from a press tool capable of achieving high surface quality and accuracy under a high speed and acceleration while surely enabling cost reduction at the same time.SOLUTION: A direct drive part 2 includes a driving shaft 3 changing rotational directions in accordance with a stroke of a ram. The driving shaft is swingably connected to a cross slider 8 via an arm 4, a bracket 5, and a quick coupling 6 for converting a rotative movement into a linear movement. The direction of the linear movement is reversed between a rear end position and a front end position of the cross slider in a working space E. The cross slider includes a base plate 27 and a member plate 26 for catching and ejecting the member. The member plate is forcibly guided horizontally movably between the rear end position and the front end position on a rail arranged on the base plate.

column12: Transgenic animal model for the treatment of skin tumors
column13: A novel animal model for the treatment of skin tumors is described. In particular, the invention provides transgenic non-human animals comprising a recombinant nucleic acid molecule containing a nucleic acid sequence encoding at least one of the gene products of the early genes of a virus of the Human Papilloma Virus Group B1, in which the animal displays one or more clinical symptoms of a tumor. The transgenic animals can be used to screen anti-tumor agents and to identify the tumorigenic potential of compounds.

column12: Device for removing precision punching respectively fine blanking parts from a tool of a press
column13: A device for removing precision punching respectively fine blanking parts from a tool of a mechanically or hydraulically driven press is provided. The device includes a linked to the ram of the press tool part and a tool part on the bedplate of the press fixed at the frame of the press, a cross slide movable transverse to the working direction of the tool parts, which is developed movable into the working area between the tool parts when one of the tool parts opens and out of it to remove the parts out of the working area when one of the tool parts closes, wherein the cross slide is connected to a fixed at the frame of the press direct drive. The direct drive comprises a drive shaft changing the turning direction in dependence of the stroke of the ram, which is pivoting connected to the cross slide via an arm , a bracket and a rapid-action coupling convert the rotating motion into a linear motion, wherein the direction of the linear motion reverses between a rear stop position and a front stop position of the cross slide in the working area. The cross slide comprises a base plate and a parts plate to take hold of and remove the parts, wherein the parts plate between the rear and front stop positions is guided horizontally movable on rails positioned on the base plate .

The present invention relates to a precursor composition comprising 
i) at least one metal-organic silver compound, 
ii) at least one metal-organic palladium compound, 
iii) at least one metal-organic copper compound, and 
iv) at least one solvent, 
wherein the composition comprises components i), ii) and iii) in such a relative amount that the composition comprises 
- at least 90 wt.-% of silver, 
- 0.01 to 5 wt.-% of palladium, and 
- 0.01 to 5 wt.-% of copper, 
in each case based on the total amount of metals in the precursor composition. The present invention also relates to a process for the production of a layered body, to a layered body obtainable by the process of the present invention, to a layered body comprising a substrate and a metal layer superimposed onto at last a part of at least one surface of the substrate and to a electronic component.

column12: Tubular component, in particular a wet razor handle, comprises inner sub-component inserted inside outer sub-component and raised areas between sub-components act as supports to form adhesive gap
column13: The final component comprises a tubular outer connecting sub-component(2) into which a tubular inner connecting sub-component(3) has been inserted. An annular gap(18) between (2) and (3) is filled with adhesive which joins them together. On the inner wall of (2) and/or outer wall(9) of (3) there are raised areas(16) which in the assembled condition press against the opposing inner or outer wall. Contacting faces of each raised area(16) lie on the same push fit diameter. In the assembled component state the raised areas form an annular gap breadth(e) of 0.1-0.15mm and the push fit diameter is concentric to both connecting components. The outer and/or inner surfaces of the two components have varying diameter along the length so that the annular gap breadth increases in size towards its free end outer. Preferably the outer wall tapers either conically or in stages, the angle(37) of taper being 10-15[deg]. Tapering commences 0.5-3mm before the free end(12) of the outer surface(9) of the inner sub-component. A section(28) with constant diameter runs into the tapering section. When the outer sub-component forms the handle of a wet razor a gripping surface is created on the surface of the outer sub-component while the inner sub-component is formed by a holding part(19) which, for extending the handle, is closed by a sleeve(27). The holder part is for batteries, current conducting paths and an electric motor(24). Independent claims are included for: a) a method of manufacturing the component in which an adhesive bead is applied around the inner surface of the outer sub-component(2) and the inner sub-component(3) is inserted concentrically into the outer sub-component as far as a stop(30); b) a method for manufacturing the component in which the tubular inner wall and/or the tubular outer wall(9) of the sub-components are produced in a galvanized plastic, part of which is removed before applying adhesive.

column12: Reciprocating internal combustion engine
column13: This invention relates to a reciprocating internal combustion engine having a cylinder crankcase in which a crankshaft is rotatably supported, to which crankshaft there is flexibly joined at least one connecting rod having a piston guided in a cylinder liner, the crankcase having fittings of an oil circulation system and various attached parts in a number independent of the number of cylinders. The crankcases with various numbers of cylinders can be cast, machined and assembled at the lowest possible cost because groups of fittings and attached parts have spacings to one of the two ends of the various cylinder crankcases (1) that remain constant.

column12: DEVICE FOR REMOVING PRECISION PUNCHING RESPECTIVELY FINE BLANKING PARTS FROM A TOOL OF A PRESS
column13: PURPOSE: A device for removing each precisely punched and finely blanked part from a tool of a press is provided to maintain surface finishing and tolerance of precisely punched and finely blanked parts and reduce costs. CONSTITUTION: A device for removing each precisely punched and finely blanked part from a tool of a press includes a direct drive(2). A drive shaft(3) of the direct drive changes rotation direction depending on the stroke of a ram(18). In order that the direct drive changes rotating motion to linear motion, the direct drive is pivoted to a cross slide(8) through an arm(4), a bracket(5), and a quick-action coupling(6). The direction of the linear motion is reversed between rear stop position and front stop position of the cross slide of a working area(E). In order that the cross slide holds and removes parts, the cross slide includes a base plate(27) and parts plate(26).

column12: Device for removing precision punching respectively fine blanking parts from a tool of a press
column13: Parts with high surface finish are removed from tools of a fine blanking press with accuracy and at high speed. The press has high opening and shutting speeds achieved by a direct drive having high acceleration power, a high turning moment, and small construction dimensions. A cross slide is movable transverse to a working direction of tool parts and is fixed at a frame of the direct drive. The direct drive includes a drive shaft which changes turning direction based on the stroke of a ram that is pivotally connected to the cross slide via an arm, a bracket, and a rapid-action coupling. Rotating motion is converted into a linear motion, which reverses between a rear stop position and a front stop position of the cross slide in a working area.

column12: Encoder and method for generating a stream of data
column13: A method generates a stream of data, wherein the stream comprises a plurality of encoded data blocks. The encoded data blocks comprise a plurality of self-contained blocks including all information for decoding the block and a plurality of blocks including only partial information for decoding. The distance of the self-contained blocks in the stream is varied dependent on the content encoded in the stream. The stream is a main stream, and wherein tuning into the main stream is effected via a secondary stream comprising at least a subset of the data blocks of the main stream encoded at a quality different from a quality of the data blocks of the main stream. The self-contained blocks are inserted at positions in the main stream where differences in the quality of the data encoded in the main stream and in the secondary stream are less detectable.

column12: FRAGMENT-ALIGNED AUDIO CODING.
column13: Audio video synchronization and alignment or alignment of audio to some other external clock are rendered more effective or easier by treating fragment grid and frame grid as independent values, but, nevertheless, for each fragment the frame grid is aligned to the respective fragment's beginning. A compression effectiveness lost may be kept low when appropriately selecting the fragment size. On the other hand, the alignment of the frame grid with respect to the fragments' beginnings allows for an easy and fragment- synchronized way of handling the fragments in connection with, for example, parallel audio video streaming, bitrate adaptive streaming or the like.

column12: Steuervorrichtung und Verfahren zum Betreiben eines elektromechanischen Bremskraftverstärkers eines Bremssystems eines Fahrzeugs
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft eine Steuervorrichtung (50) für zumindest einen elektromechanischen Bremskraftverstärker (52) eines Bremssystems eines Fahrzeugs, mit einer Elektronikeinrichtung (54), welche dazu ausgelegt ist, unter Berücksichtigung zumindest eines Bremsvorgabesignals (58) bezüglich eines Bremswunsches zumindest eine Soll-Größe bezüglich einer Soll-Drehgeschwindigkeit eines Motors des elektromechanischen Bremskraftverstärkers (52) festzulegen und mindestens ein Steuersignal (56) an den Motor auszugeben, wobei die Elektronikeinrichtung (54) zusätzlich dazu ausgelegt ist, unter Berücksichtigung zumindest einer aktuellen Stromstärke (I) eines Motorstroms des Motors und eines aktuellen Drehwinkels (φ) eines Rotors des Motors (52) eine Höchst-Soll-Größe bezüglich einer maximalen Soll-Drehgeschwindigkeit des Motors des elektromechanischen Bremskraftverstärkers (52) festzulegen und die Soll-Größe bezüglich der Soll-Drehgeschwindigkeit des Motors des elektromechanischen Bremskraftverstärkers (52) höchstens gleich der festgelegten Höchst-Soll-Größe festzulegen. Ebenso betrifft die Erfindung ein entsprechendes Verfahren zum Betreiben eines elektromechanischen Bremskraftverstärkers (52) eines Bremssystems eines Fahrzeugs.
column15: VOLLERT HERBERT;;GERDES MANFRED;;BINDER CHRISTIAN;;MAHNKOPF DIRK;;FUCHS OLIVER

column12: ENCODER AND METHOD FOR GENERATING A STREAM OF DATA
column13: A method generates a stream of data, wherein the stream comprises a plurality of encoded data blocks. The encoded data blocks comprise a plurality of self-contained blocks including all information for decoding the block and a plurality of blocks including only partial information for decoding. The distance of the self-contained blocks in the stream is varied dependent on the content encoded in the stream. The stream is a main stream, and wherein tuning into the main stream is effected via a secondary stream comprising at least a subset of the data blocks of the main stream encoded at a quality different from a quality of the data blocks of the main stream. The self-contained blocks are inserted at positions in the main stream where differences in the quality of the data encoded in the main stream and in the secondary stream are less detectable.

column12: Battery Manufacturing
column13: A method of manufacturing a battery is provided. A cathode assembly is provided, including a cathode and a cathode tab. The cathode tab is welded to a positive terminal of the battery. The areas to be welded are cleaned prior to welding to remove an oxide layer.

column12: FRAGMENT-ALIGNED AUDIO CODING
column13: Audio video synchronization and alignment or alignment of audio to some other external clock are rendered more effective or easier by treating fragment grid and frame grid as independent values, but,nevertheless, for each fragment the frame grid is aligned to the respective fragment's beginning. A compression effectiveness lost may be kept low when appropriately selecting the fragment size. On the other hand, the alignment of the frame grid with respect to the fragments' beginnings allows for an easy and fragment- synchronized way of handling the fragments in connection with, for example, parallel audio video streaming, bitrate adaptive streaming or the like.

column12: FRAME ALIGNED AUDIO ENCODING
column13: FIELD: physics.SUBSTANCE: invention relates to an audio codec for use in parallel with encoded video. Technical result is achieved by the fact that as a result of considering the fragment grid and the frame grid as independent values, but nevertheless, for each fragment the frame grid is aligned with the beginning of the corresponding fragment. Loss of compression efficiency can be kept low with a suitable choice of fragment size. On the other hand, the alignment of the frame grid relative to the beginning of the fragments provides for an easy and synchronized with the fragment method of processing fragments with respect to, for example, parallel streaming of audio and video, adaptive in speed to streaming.EFFECT: technical result is to ensure synchronization and alignment of audio and video.22 cl, 1 tbl, 8 dwg

column12: Ring spinner
column13: The ring spinner has two bobbins (12) of rovings and a multi-stage drawing unit. A suction roller (25), with a perforated mantle surface (35), condenses the rovings, to be spun by the ring spinner (17) into a twisted yarn. The compact fibre strands (22,22'), in a width of not more than 1.5 mm and pref. less than 1 mm formed by the suction roller (25), are combined after the twist barrier gap (16) so that they are twisted only by the ring spinner (17). Also claimed is an operation where the fibre strands (22,22') are at least partially separated from each other at the suction roller (25), to be passed together to the separate spinner (17), to be twisted together.

column12: 차량의 브레이크 시스템의 전기 기계식 브레이크 부스터의 제어 장치 및 작동 방법
column13: 본 발명은 차량의 브레이크 시스템의 적어도 하나의 전기 기계식 브레이크 부스터(52)용 제어 장치(50)에 관한 것이며, 상기 제어 장치는, 제동 요구에 대한 적어도 하나의 브레이크 입력 신호(58)를 고려하여, 전기 기계식 브레이크 부스터(52)의 모터의 목표 회전 속도에 대한 적어도 하나의 목표 변수를 결정하고 적어도 하나의 제어 신호(56)를 상기 모터로 출력하도록 설계된 전자 유닛(54)을 포함한다. 또한, 전자 유닛(54)은 모터의 모터 전류의 적어도 하나의 현재 전류 세기(I) 및 모터(52)의 회전자의 현재 회전 각(φ)을 고려하여, 전기 기계식 브레이크 부스터(52)의 모터의 최대 목표 회전 속도에 대한 최대 목표 변수를 결정하고 전기 기계식 브레이크 부스터(52)의 모터의 목표 회전 속도에 대한 목표 변수를 최대로 상기 결정된 최대 목표 변수와 동일하게 결정하도록 설계된다. 본 발명은 또한 차량의 브레이크 시스템의 전기 기계식 브레이크 부스터(52)를 작동시키는 방법에 관한 것이다.

column12: Component with a reflector layer and method for producing the same
column13: In a known component having a reflector layer, the surface of a base body of quartz glass is covered at least in part with a reflector layer. Starting from this, to provide a component, particularly for use in lamp and reflector manufacture, which is equipped with an efficient, chemically and thermally resistant and, nevertheless, inexpensive reflector layer, it is suggested according to the invention that an SiO 2 cover layer should be provided which acts as a diffuse reflector and consists of at least partly opaque quartz glass. The method of the invention for producing such a component is characterized in that a slip which contains amorphous SiO 2 particles is produced and applied to the surface of the base body with formation of a slip layer, the slip layer is dried and then vitrified with formation of an SiO 2 cover layer.

column12: REDUCING A TUNE-IN DELAY INTO A SCALABLE ENCODED DATA STREAM
column13: A method for reducing a tune-in delay upon tuning into a scalable encoded data stream is described, wherein the scalable encoded data stream is provided by an encoder and comprises a base layer stream and at least one enhancement layer stream. The base layer stream and the enhancement layer stream are provided from the encoder to a decoder with substantially the same encoder-to-decoder delay.

column13: Taco de tornillo con un tornillo (1) que presenta, en un extremo, una rosca exterior (2) y, en el extremo opuesto, una cabeza de expansión (3) que se amplía en la dirección de colocación (S), y con un manguito de expansión (4) que puede ensancharse mediante la cabeza de expansión (3), presentando el tornillo (1), sobre la cara frontal (15) alejada por el lado de la dirección de colocación, al menos una depresión periférica (16) con una profundidad (1), estando configurada la depresión (16) abierta hacia la cara frontal (15) y hacia el perímetro exterior del tornillo (1), caracterizado porque están previstas varias depresiones (16) sobre la cara frontal (15) del tornillo (1) alejada por el lado de la dirección de colocación, que presentan una sección transversal aproximadamente triangular en la proyección radial.
